custom.usage:
import { WebService } from "@cloudcamp/aws-runtime";
const { WebService } = require("@cloudcamp/aws-runtime");
from cloudcamp.aws_runtime import WebService
using Cloudcamp.Aws.Runtime;
import cloudcamp.aws.runtime.WebService;

docs.remarks:
WebService runs any web application behing a load balancers as docker containers. For example, this runs a web application as a single container exposed on port 8080:

new WebService(app.production, "prod-web", {
   dockerfile: "../Dockerfile",
   port: 8080
});
new WebService(app.production, "prod-web", {
   dockerfile: "../Dockerfile",
   port: 8080
});
void 0;
import { App, WebService } from "@cloudcamp/aws-runtime";
let app = new App();
void 'show';
new WebService(app.production, "prod-web", {
   dockerfile: "../Dockerfile",
   port: 8080
});
void 0;
import { App, WebService } from "@cloudcamp/aws-runtime";
let app = new App();
void 'show';
new WebService(app.production, "prod-web", {
   dockerfile: "../Dockerfile",
   port: 8080
});
void 0;
import { App, WebService } from "@cloudcamp/aws-runtime";
let app = new App();
void 'show';
new WebService(app.production, "prod-web", {
   dockerfile: "../Dockerfile",
   port: 8080
});
docs.summary: A scalable web server running one or more docker containers behind a load balancer.

custom.remarks: During initialization you can configure: Custom domains, SSL, machine configuration, health checks and the default number of instances.
custom.signature: new WebService(scope: undefined, id: string, props: WebServiceProps)new WebService(scope, id, props)new WebService(scope: undefined, id: str, **kwargs: WebServiceProps)new WebService(scope: undefined, id: String, props: WebServiceProps)new WebService(undefined scope, String id, WebServiceProps props)

docs.remarks:
Examples:

To use your own domain and serve traffic via SSL, use the domain and ssl properties:

new WebService(app.production, "prod", {
   dockerfile: "../Dockerfile",
   domain: "example.com",
   ssl: true
});
new WebService(app.production, "prod", {
   dockerfile: "../Dockerfile",
   domain: "example.com",
   ssl: true
});
void 0;
import { App, WebService } from "@cloudcamp/aws-runtime";
let app = new App();
void 'show';

new WebService(app.production, "prod", {
   dockerfile: "../Dockerfile",
   domain: "example.com",
   ssl: true
});
void 0;
import { App, WebService } from "@cloudcamp/aws-runtime";
let app = new App();
void 'show';

new WebService(app.production, "prod", {
   dockerfile: "../Dockerfile",
   domain: "example.com",
   ssl: true
});
void 0;
import { App, WebService } from "@cloudcamp/aws-runtime";
let app = new App();
void 'show';

new WebService(app.production, "prod", {
   dockerfile: "../Dockerfile",
   domain: "example.com",
   ssl: true
});

See domain:create and cert:create for more information on setting up domains/SSL.
